<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
STARTUPS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/08/global-venture-funding-uses-momentum-2021s-first-quarter-hit-record-highs-second-quarter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It’s All Funding and Games
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/08/global-venture-funding-uses-momentum-2021s-first-quarter-hit-record-highs-second-quarter?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Man at stack of cash saying "Here's money! Go!"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/RHIYhjyA2R8IibyqPU/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Man at stack of cash saying " Here's money! Go!"" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/RHIYhjyA2R8IibyqPU/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While most of us are spending money on cocktails we finally don’t have to make ourselves, venture capitalists are shelling out cash like they just got a stimulus check. Startups globally raised a record $156 billion last quarter, per a <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ccfc6bbd-56b6-4cef-b89d-4f88ceb7b126?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new report</a> from CB Insights.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s driving the surge? </strong>A low-interest rate environment, the digital transformation spurred by the pandemic, and more private equity and hedge fund participation in startup investing, our friends at Emerging Tech Brew explain.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Some highlights from the report</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">An army of unicorns.</strong> 136 new startups achieved a billion-dollar valuation last quarter alone, stampeding the 128 unicorns created in all of 2020. The number of new unicorns has grown 491% over last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fintech flexing.</strong> $1 out of every $5 raised globally last quarter went to the fintech industry, for a total of $33.7 billion. With Stripe and Klarna, fintech boasts two of the five most valuable unicorns in the world. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Silicon Valley is the next Silicon Valley.</strong> Sorry, Austin, but funding for companies in the Bay Area jumped 93% from Q2 2020, which gave Silicon Valley its second consecutive $20+ billion quarter. It’s “still by far the largest tech hub,” says CB Insights. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">And it’s still Tiger Global’s world</strong>. The New York-based crossover fund, which invests in both private and public companies, was closing over <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/04/tiger-global-management-eating-vc-world?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four deals</a> per week on average in Q1, but in Q2 managed to bump that up to 1.3 deals <em>per day</em>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>As Joshua Chao, venture capital analyst at PitchBook, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2021/06/28/2021-unicorn-frenzy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a> Emerging Tech Brew last week, “For entrepreneurs, this is possibly one of the most founder-friendly periods we’ve seen in several years.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">+ You can access the full report from CB Insights <a href="https://www.cbinsights.com/research/report/venture-trends-q2-2021/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">here</a>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/08/10year-treasury-yield-plunges-lowest-level-since-february?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What the 10-Year Yield Is Trying to Tell Us
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Weird stock market " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODU2L3dlaXJkX3N0b2NrX21hcmtldC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Easy there, tiger. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The yield on the 10-year Treasury note, which serves as a benchmark for interest rates across the US economy, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/08/investing/bond-yields-economy-inflation/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell</a> for an eighth straight day yesterday to below 1.3%—the lowest level since February. Since bond prices and yields move in opposite directions, falling yields signal higher demand for Treasuries.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters</strong>: At the most basic level, the 10-year yield is a key indicator of investors’ confidence in future US economic growth. As the Delta variant spreads and threatens to slow the economic recovery, the fall in yields means investors are souring on a mega growth spurt and snapping up safer assets rather than riskier stocks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What does this mean for inflation? </strong>Because investors <em>sell </em>bonds when they think inflation is coming, the runup in bond prices means the worst of Wall Street's inflation concerns may be over. “It feels like we have moved from thinking inflation will be transitory, to fearing growth will be transitory,” Art Hogan, chief marketing strategist at National Securities, <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/asia-eyes-steady-open-bonds-up-amid-taper-debate-markets-wrap?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>.</p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DELIVERY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/08/fidji-simo-facebook-exec-will-replace-apoorva-mehta-ceo-instacart?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">

</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="BEVERLY HILLS, CA - JULY 25:  Fidji Simo, Director of Product at Facebook" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NzAxL3N1bW1lcl8yMDE4X3RjYV9wcmVzc190b3UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Frederick M. Brown/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Facebook’s exec softball team needs a new shortstop because Fidji Simo, the head of the company’s flagship app, is <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/07/08/instacart-new-ceo-fidji-simo-comes-from-facebook.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">leaving</a> to become the CEO of Instacart. Simo will succeed Apoorva Mehta, who founded the grocery delivery app in 2012, next month.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who is Simo?</strong> One of the most powerful senior executives at Facebook. Simo spent the last decade building Facebook’s mobile and product teams, impressing Instacart’s Mehta. He told CNBC, “To be honest, the idea of someone else running the company had never even crossed my mind. But I’ve been blown away by her capabilities as a leader.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Thanks to booming growth during the pandemic, Instacart is currently the third-largest US-based startup. Its valuation quadrupled to $39 billion in just the last year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Simo will be responsible for maintaining that growth in the face of more competition, and ensuring the company sticks the landing to its upcoming IPO later this year.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/07/08/key-performance-indicators-july-9?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="An illustration of a generic-looking brick factory; trees are growing out of the top of its three smokestacks" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zODU4L3N1c3RhaW5hYmlsaXR5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>Rising demand for energy in the US will result in a 15% increase in American coal production this year, according to the Energy Department—that would be the biggest production jump since 1990. “The shift underscores the vicious circle of climate change as more extreme temperatures drive power demand just as extensive drought cuts output from hydropower dams,” Bloomberg <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-08/coal-output-in-u-s-seen-rising-most-since-1990-on-global-demand?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explains</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“At this time, we have decided to stop contributing to those members of Congress who contested the certification of certain states in the 2020 election.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Toyota <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/07/08/business/lincoln-project-ad-campaign.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> the move yesterday after being criticized in an ad campaign for its donations to GOP lawmakers who objected to certifying last November’s presidential election. The automaker has donated $55,000 to 37 Republican objectors this year, according to the Citizens for Responsibility and Ethics in Washington.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>“Cat Person” and me. (<a href="https://slate.com/human-interest/2021/07/cat-person-kristen-roupenian-viral-story-about-me.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Slate</a>)</p>

Go!\"\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/RHIYhjyA2R8IibyqPU/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhile most of us are spending money on cocktails we finally don’t have to make ourselves, venture capitalists are shelling out cash like they just got a stimulus check. Startups globally raised a record $156 billion last quarter, per a \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/ccfc6bbd-56b6-4cef-b89d-4f88ceb7b126?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enew report\u003c/a\u003e from CB Insights.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s driving the surge? \u003c/strong\u003eA low-interest rate environment, the digital transformation spurred by the pandemic, and more private equity and hedge fund participation in startup investing, our friends at Emerging Tech Brew explain.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSome highlights from the report\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAn army of unicorns.\u003c/strong\u003e 136 new startups achieved a billion-dollar valuation last quarter alone, stampeding the 128 unicorns created in all of 2020. The number of new unicorns has grown 491% over last year.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFintech flexing.\u003c/strong\u003e $1 out of every $5 raised globally last quarter went to the fintech industry, for a total of $33.7 billion. With Stripe and Klarna, fintech boasts two of the five most valuable unicorns in the world. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSilicon Valley is the next Silicon Valley.\u003c/strong\u003e Sorry, Austin, but funding for companies in the Bay Area jumped 93% from Q2 2020, which gave Silicon Valley its second consecutive $20+ billion quarter. It’s “still by far the largest tech hub,” says CB Insights. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAnd it’s still Tiger Global’s world\u003c/strong\u003e. The New York-based crossover fund, which invests in both private and public companies, was closing over \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/05/04/tiger-global-management-eating-vc-world?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour deals\u003c/a\u003e per week on average in Q1, but in Q2 managed to bump that up to 1.3 deals \u003cem\u003eper day\u003c/em\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAs Joshua Chao, venture capital analyst at PitchBook, \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2021/06/28/2021-unicorn-frenzy?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e Emerging Tech Brew last week, “For entrepreneurs, this is possibly one of the most founder-friendly periods we’ve seen in several years.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e+ You can access the full report from CB Insights style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEasy there, tiger. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe yield on the 10-year Treasury note, which serves as a benchmark for interest rates across the US economy, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/07/08/investing/bond-yields-economy-inflation/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell\u003c/a\u003e for an eighth straight day yesterday to below 1.3%—the lowest level since February. Since bond prices and yields move in opposite directions, falling yields signal higher demand for Treasuries.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters\u003c/strong\u003e: At the most basic level, the 10-year yield is a key indicator of investors’ confidence in future US economic growth. As the Delta variant spreads and threatens to slow the economic recovery, the fall in yields means investors are souring on a mega growth spurt and snapping up safer assets rather than riskier stocks.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat does this mean for inflation? \u003c/strong\u003eBecause investors \u003cem\u003esell \u003c/em\u003ebonds when they think inflation is coming, the runup in bond prices means the worst of Wall Street's inflation concerns may be over. “It feels like we have moved from thinking inflation will be transitory, to fearing growth will be transitory,” Art Hogan, chief marketing strategist at National Securities, \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2021-07-07/asia-eyes-steady-open-bonds-up-amid-taper-debate-markets-wrap?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\"
